reference.title: fiprintf : format output to file (integer only)

section.title: Description
section.p: fiprintf is a restricted version of fprintf: it has the same arguments and behavior, save that it cannot perform any floating-point formatting--the f, g, G, e, and F type specifiers are not recognized.

section.title: Returns
section.p: fiprintf returns the number of bytes in the output string, save that the concluding NULL is not counted. fiprintf returns when the end of the format string is encountered. If an error occurs, fiprintf returns EOF.
